Dialog.text: Goddamn waiting is driving me crazy. But better than being dead.
Are you ready for your instructions, my lady?
Oh sure. Thank you. Hey - maybe it's not my place, but...
Yesterday's batch was an abysmal failure. Pisspoor root initiation.
Calvino. What did you do to my conference room?
Dialog.notes: (Hans Kelstrup) Annoyed. Has a meeting to get to. Talking to a subordinate.

Dialog.text: All I see... is a dot.
(Sigh) Are you kidding me?
I'll call you back.
Whoa, whoa, hey now! Step away from there, Doctor!
Dialog.notes: [Sam Hertz] Frantic when player messes with the door that is holding back a flood of aliens

Dialog.text: Anna. You're supposed to be off today.
Dialog.notes: (Hans Kelstrup) Why are you bothering me with this shit again.

Dialog.text: Dr. Thorstein?
Dialog.notes: (Thaddeus York) I little stunned. Doesn't know what's going on, but hears distant alarms.

Dialog.text: Escape pods. Can you get to us?
Well - we're all stuck here, anyway. We can't get these pods open.
Yeah. Maybe.
Bayer? Did you hear that?
Send an Operator.
Was it those things? Did they shut the air off?
It doesn't matter though, right? I mean, should be hours before we run out.
Dialog.notes: (Nils Kjaergaard) Trying to find a silver lining.

Dialog.text: What? But...

Chief, yeah... so I checked that flight plan for the Volunteer Shuttle like you requested. You're right - it went dark for twelve minutes before it resumed a path towards Earth - but at a slightly different trajectory than before.
Did you see me take out that one? Nailed him. Right in his stupid tentacles.
Ready as I'll ever be.
I thought out of all of us, Elazar would make it.
Dwayne, too? But... I was sure he'd make it.
Al, ol' buddy, I'll miss you. Never thought it'd end like this.
I... I don't know.
Yes.
I don't know Drew. I'm sorry.
I can't do that.
Bolts on the outside hatch misfired. We're stuck in the launch tube.
Hello? Is someone- I'm in the escape pod with Emmanuella Desilva. We're stuck in the launch tube.
Dialog.notes: (Frank Jones) Something squierrely about this guy

Dialog.text: The hatch on the outside is supposed to blow when the pod launch initiates... but I guess the bolts misfired.
Could you help us out? You'd have to EVA to get the hatch off from the outside.
I know it's a lot to ask... I don't know what else to do... Sit here and starve, I guess.
That should do it. Now just head back in and hit that launch switch for us.
Hey! What are you doing? If you hit that switch, we'll smash into the damn hatch. You have to get it off first.
Wait! What are you doing? Ah... Dammit. Okay - okay - listen! I don't know what you saw or read or- it's not what it looks like.
Hey Lane, this is Gus down in Cargo. Hey listen, uh... did you order any Reployers from Earth?
Reployer. It's uh... machine.
Well, I'm not sure. I was hoping that you could tell me.
You're an industrial designer right, so I thought you would know.
I did! I've been asking everyone. No one ordered it or knows anything about it.
That'd be great. Thanks, Lane!
Initiating test procedure 29. Variant C. Subject V-010655-32.
Dialog.notes: (Hans Kelstrup). Dry, clinical. Like doctors describing events around an operating table.

Dialog.text: Pyschoscopes on, everyone.
Prep the Typhon Cacoplasmus.
Track his vitals.
Make a note. Replication followed the usual pattern. Appears unaffected by the subject's age.
Morgan? Did you get a good scan?
Matthew. I have a... uh... hypothetical question for you.
Dialog.notes: (Emmanuel Mendez) Nervous. Wound a little tight.

Dialog.text: I think I'm going to be sick.
Corpse? Maybe... I don't know, maybe it saved him? It could still be Enoch.
Sarah will get us out of this. She got us this far. We're safe in here.
Eventually. Had to wait a while. Two assholes from the sales team chose that exact moment to stand under the alarm bell and smoke cigars.
Yeah. Just made the last shipment. Should be Earthside by morning, Pacific Time.
Drop site?
Of course it works. Three taps with a wrench. That'll pop it open. All of them will work that way by tomorrow.
Dialog.notes: (Eddie Voss) How dare you even ask.

Dialog.text: ...I don't think so, Chief. The main lift and all the airlocks shut down at once. It had to be manual.
Chief, I'm not a comm tech, I'm doing the best I can-
Dialog.notes: (Sam Hertz) {Background, defensive, a bit meek/apologetic, has a good heart}

Dialog.text: Check the wrench first.
(Sigh) Let's stay focused everyone.
Permission to release? Morgan?
Dialog.notes: (Hans Kelstrup) Asking Morgan for the greenlight.

Dialog.text: I've already told you the V.A.C's are sealed documents. My hands are tied.
(Deep Breath) Look. I understand. I really do. You wouldn't be human if this was easy.
Believe me. Everything we've done is perfectly legal.
Anna. You're tired. It's affecting your judgement. Now, I've tolerated it for a while, but enough is enough.
You need to take some time. Understood?
Good. Look, you've made me late for a meeting with Alex.
(Clears Throat) Mr. Yu. This Eddie Voss. I work down in Cargo.
Dialog.notes: (Eddie Voss) Nervous. He's confessing. Hoping for mercy.

Dialog.text: The fact is, we've been stealing from you, sir.
It started small - just moving harmless contraband on and off the station. Pharmas, food not on the "safe" list.
I don't know, maybe you don't pay your techs in Hardware enough. But... Lily got ambitious after a while.
Started stealing Neuromods. Fabrication plans. Selling them to TranStar rivals.
Yeah. Sit on that for a sec, Mr. Yu. Kasma's got our I.P. now.
Dialog.notes: (Eddie Voss) I'm going to get in big trouble for this.

Dialog.text: Lily made me modify some of the old alarm panels around Talos so we could use them as dead drops.
I'm certain a few of them still have company property. Three taps with a wrench will pop it open.
Anyway - I just wanted to say... I never meant for things get out of hand. It just took on a life of it's own after a while.
No, I do not. This is serious.
Let's say you discovered something... incredibly treacherous. Life-threatening. Something everyone ought to know about.
But! But... you needed to do it anonymously.
Dialog.notes: (Emmanuel Mendez) Rushing to fill in, like "wait, wait... there's more"

Dialog.text: I didn't do anything. Not yet.
Not a bad idea. Thank you, Matthew.
Dialog.notes: (Emmanuel Mendez) First part to himself almost.

Dialog.text: And for the record, your bottom looks frumpy.
Dammit Calvino, I do not have time to play sing along with your bouncing ball.
Machine shop. I was just- I... heard an explosion.
What? What should I-
Yes, sir.
However, Dr. Linn from Psychotronics was kind enough to provide me with a sample of material that should multiply the effectiveness of the phytohormones when applied to already mature plants.
I expect reduced time to maturity, increased yield, and an above normal salutary effect.
Hopefully... it doesn't taste like shit.
I just need permission to run the plan through the Fabricator.
Well, it's just that there was a minor leak and uh... I told Connolly we should wait for new parts, but...
Don't patronize me, Lily.
I'll keep spamming the security computers with help requests. Maybe someone will notice eventually.
First - you must journey to the tree where we carved our initials.
And don't worry about work. Mikhaila said you could take an extra shift since it's your birthday.
This keycard will unlock everything your heart desires.
Run like hell. Julien the Ogre does not like people touching his trees. Or his fruit.
Anyway - beneath a stone you will find a magical keycard.
Yes. I'd like to arrange a time to oversee installation of a special particle injector in the water treatment facility.
I've already confirmed the inlet and outlet fittings are to spec.
I'm not at liberty to say.
Dr. Kelstrup has already seen and approved-
There's an override switch behind the panel to force a pod launch.
But... don't hit that until the outside hatch is off.
We'd be blown to bits.
It's almost unnoticeable, like it left from a different part of the station, or changed its flight pattern around Talos.
It's only the Volunteer shuttles - but it's all of them. They go dark 8-10 minutes after leaving the station, then suddenly re-appear. The VIP shuttles don't show the same... irregularity.
About what, Chief?
They can't even respect our dead.
That thing... it was like it was... sewing Enoch into one of their... silhouettes.
God, watching those things move... makes me sick.
Sarah was tough, but fair. I mean, mostly tough, but... for an officer, she was one of the best.
Guess you lost that bet, Chief. I'll miss you, Sarah. Even the yelling.
He never even got to see his wife again.
First his wife, now him. Usually it's the other way around.
Well, Austin, you're with the angels now. Probably making them all devils.
Tamiko didn't deserve this. Of all of us...
Dialog.notes: [Sam Hertz] "she deserved to survive" remains unspoken

Dialog.text: Tamiko died following orders. It's what she wanted.
Love you, Mom.
See you in hell, Dad.
Dialog.notes: [Sam Hertz] even more under his breath

Dialog.text: Now or never.
Ammo - check. Breathing - check. Scared - check.
God, that felt good. Er, sir.
God, that felt good. Er, ma'am.
Well, that's some fine shooting, if I do say so myself.
Wasn't sure how that would play out, but I like how it did.
I need a cigarette.
Guess Elazar owes me that kiss... on my lily white ass.
I work for a living, Captain Elazar's over there.
Don't tell her I said that.
Has everyone gone crazy?!
Great, now Dr. Yu's lost it! Always knew he was crazy!
Great, now Dr. Yu's lost it! Always knew she was crazy!
Glad you got the lifts working - next stop, the Arboretum, huh? Or the Shuttle Bay.
Sweet mother of Jesus!
I am not seeing this. I am not seeing this.
I'm a good shot, but I'd rather have a few turrets covering me.
How's the hunt going for those E.A.T. plans?
A few Eradicators would really boost morale around here.
I feel better with these bad boys standing guard - thanks, Dr. Yu.
These E.A.T.s - some of us call them "eats" because they chew through ammo like a fat kid on cake.
Is there a setting for the Eradicators beyond full auto?
Can't wait to let these turrets loose on those shapechanging assholes.
I hope the next door you open is an airlock, sir.
I hope the next door you open is an airlock, ma'am.
You better watch yourself, Morgan. You need people watching your back, not aiming at it.
You can practically guarantee the situation's FUBAR'd when a "Commander" shows up. Who is this Dahl guy?
This Dahl sounds like he needs a few rounds in his backside.
Christ... I can't believe I'm grateful to breathe Talos air again.
I'm just enjoying breathing again - thanks.
This Dahl fights as clean as a typical TranStar officer.
No offense.
Heard you took down Dahl. I owe you. A beer. A case of beer.
Wish I could have watched you kill Dahl.
Hope you choked Dahl out like he tried to choke us out.
Thanks for getting to Mika, I doubt any of us could have done it - even Elazar.
Dialog.notes: [Sam Hertz] [RICARDO SCRIPT: May not play if Mika didn't make an annoucement.]

Dialog.text: Captain Elazar was worried about Mika - thanks for setting her mind at ease.
Dialog.notes: [Sam Hertz] [RICARDO SCRIPT: May not play if Mika didn't make an annoucement.]

Dialog.text: Don't know if Wiggy... er, Dr. Igwe... is lucky to be here or not. Might have been safer in his crate.
Thanks for getting Chaudhary back to us - she's still rattled. Says the things were in her mind.
Not how I expected to end my rotation, but if this is how I go out, this is how I go out.
Last post - Talos I. Guess I kind of suspected it all along.
Wonder what happens to my pension.
Should have taken out that TranStar life insurance policy.

Dialog.notes: (Rodney Poole) Desperate. Shouting. Banging on the glass.

Dialog.text: Anybody in there?
C'mon dammit! Somebody open this door!

Dialog.notes: (Rodney Poole) Harsh. Under his breath, 'I'm going to die."

Dialog.text: Hey! Hey over here! Open this door!
There's something after me.
Can you get it open?
C'mon just... just smash the GLOO off. Something!
Good thing we have a Medical Operator, huh? We'll all be back in fighting shape soon.
Some of the officers reported seeing glowing structures. Called it "coral". The creatures are making it. But why?
I'm headed out there as we speak.
Hard to say until I lay eyes on it. Could be some micro meteoroids punched a hole. Rare, but it happens.
Is there something you're not telling me?
I understand.
But I'd like to make it right. Any way I can. That's all.
